Sabrina licked her chops as she patted her swollen belly. The last trainer she had faced lost here so as punishment, she decided to swallow her up along with her Pokemon. Well, not really punishment. Lately Sabrina had been ravenously hungry and needed food something fierce. In a fit one day, her appetite got the better of her and she swallowed up one of the trainers who came to this Gym.

The taste had been so delectable that she wanted more.

So she decided recently to use her position as Gym Leader like a ploy of sorts; whenever trainers came to challenge her and lost, she would swallow them up for a nice, quick and easy meal. Sabrina purred as she rubbed her swollen belly, which grounded her thanks to how packed full it was. She couldn't wait to see what happened when she digested her meal. One thing she noticed was that heavy meals like this, of course, were chock full of calories. She could easily pack on a large amount of weight from even her "Small" meals. 112.content:
Sigh,"So bored. I know being a Gym Leader can be slow, but this is ridiculous," Sabrina muttered to herself.

It had been three weeks since the last trainer had come to the gym. In those three weeks she had run out of things to occupy her time. Training her pokemon was pointless if no one came to the gym.

'Like they need it,' she thought with pride at the strength of her pokemon. Sadly the thought only lifted her spirits for a short time. Running her hand through her metallic blue hair one last time, she got up from couch and walked into her kitchen for something to eat. Walking to the her fridge, she begins to pull out a pre-made green salad. Something behind it catches her eye, reaching passed the salad, she pulls out a plate with a piece of chocolate cake on it.

'Hmmm, I don't remember putting this in the fridge.' She thought. Suddenly the memory come to her.

"Hey cuz," said a loud teen age girl as she twirled in a circle in front of Sabrina. Sabrina just glared at her cousin.
"What do you want, Sonia?" The young girl twisted her cyan colored hair.
"You missed my birthday," Sabrina's eyes soften.
"Sonia, I am so sorry. I have been so busy at the gym I forgot.""I know so I brought you a piece of birthday cake."

'Sonia.'

Grabbing a fork from the silverware drawer, she sat down at the table. She stared at the cake for a few minutes. 'When was the last time I had sweets?' She looked down at her trim, fit body. She had worked so hard to keep herself fit. Shaking herself out of her thought, she shrugged. 'One piece of cake isn't going to kill me.'

Taking a small bite of cake, she nearly dropped her fork. " Oh my god!!!" she whispered breathlessly. The sudden burst of flavor caught her off guard. She quickly devoured the cake. Leaning back in her chair and sighed in content.

Ring, Ring

Getting up, she made her way to the phone.

1141.content:
Sabrina the Psychic Pokemon Master of Saffron City entered the main battling arena from her meditation chambers to meet the opposing trainer in her gym. At first glance, he looked like your run of the mill curious trainer from some podunk town. But with her universally synced mind, Sabrina was mentally blown away from his immense aura. This kid was not your average trainer, no one could match that level of determination even with years of mastery.

Slightly impressed, Sabrina smirked and placed her hand on her hips to strike a pose. She began her practised opening monologue that she had repeated to other kids hundreds of times. “I knew you were coming...three years ago I had a vision of your arrival.” She lied to the kid, who raised his eyebrows in slight shock. While Sabrina can predict when and who will enter her gym, she focuses her Psychic powers on more pressing work.

“You're after my Badge. I don't enjoy battling, but it's my duty as a Leader to confer Badge on anyone who has proven himself worthy.” Again, she lied. Sabrina does not let anybody know this, but she actually loves to battle her Pokemon. The shedding of their Psychic attacks is absorbed into her soul, making her even more powerful as a Psychic.

“Since you wish it, I will show you my psychic powers!" With that, Sabrina ended her speech and called out her first Pokemon. Tossing her Pokeball into the air, the metallic sphere opened to spew out liquid light. From that light came the Sun Pokemon, Espeon, already in an attack stance. The child on the other end of the battlefield and appraised the Psychic Eeveelution to determine the best course of action. After some time, the kid finally revealed his opposing Pokemon, a Beedrill.

Sabrina once again felt the energy of the cosmos flow through her blood. She could feel the impossible strength of the bond between the Beedrill and it’s trainer. The look the two of them shared was not that of bond between master and slave; it was a special kinship forged in fire that could not be broken.

Unbeknownst to Sabrina, the resulting surge in energy from the great beyond had altered her physical figure. Instead of absorbing into her soul like her Pokemon attacks, the energy stuck to her body in the form of fat. It was hardly noticeable, a sliver of jiggle weight on her stomach and arms; but it was there. It was hungry from more of this kid’s auru to expand.

“Espeon, use Psychic!” Sabrina ordered, starting the battle off. The Sun Pokemon’s eyes glowed neon pink, and a beam of raw energy burst from it’s forehead, aimed right at the Beedrill in front of it.

“Beedrill, dodge it!” The kid instructed. The Beedrill effortlessly move out of the beam’s way, forcing it to crash into the wall behind him. Sabrina, once again, felt the rush of power from the Universe as she absorbed both her Pokemon’s attack and the Trainer’s aura. Her frame bloated again, this time even more pronounced as more energy was flooded into her body. She had no idea what it was doing her waistline, but Sabrina was left wanting more.

“C-confusion!” Sabrina ordered, a bit excited from her last surge. The Espeon worlessley obeyed and casted it’s attack. The Beedrill couldn't dodge it this time.

But much to the Espeon’s own confusion, the Beedrill did not even flinch as it’s mind turned into mush. No crossed yes or frantic movements, absolutely nothing!

“Beedrill, take advantage and use Poison Jab!” The Kid ordered. To both the Espeon’s and Sabrina’s shock, the Beedrill simply gritted it’s teeth and turned it’s head to the side violently, casting off the confusion like swatting a fly. With incredible speed it zoomed across the field and delivered a poison laced blow to the Psychic Eeveelution, knocking it to ti’s feet.

This time, Sabrina’s body not only expanded, but also blew up. Her slim, washboard stomach now carried a potbelly, her breasts and ass ballooning out somewhat, stretching against the fabric of her clothes. Her hips and thighs grew, and her facial featured became less defined. And although she still has failed to recognize her new weight, the Kid and the Beedrill certainly have.

“What?” Sabrina asked impatiently as the two of them tilted their heads at Sabrina’s fattened body. Was she like this when the battle started? “Stop staring at me and get on with the battle! Espeo, use Psybeam!”

And so the battle continued, the overpowered Beedrill and the rest of the Kid's Pokemon easily crushing Sabrina's team of three. And all the while, she became fatter and fatter, much to the shock of the opposing trainer and his Pokemon. By the end of it all, the Kid and won, and Sabrina had expanded to...

115.content:
Sabrina sighed as she leaned back. She was bored. Plain and simple she was bored. No one had made it to challenge her lately, the Gym saw few visitors and hadn't had a worthwhile battle in months. She even started going to the Gym less and less, becoming a bit lazier and more of a slob as she did. She only wore her usual top lately and white pants, but those were starting to get more then snug that was for sure.

Her lazier tendencies had caused excessive eating on her part and a lack of exercise only helped facilitate her rise in weight. She had already put on about forty pounds within the past few weeks, her belly swollen into a sizable muffin top as her folds flowed a tad over her wider hips and her butt made her pants fairly close to ripping in the back as well.

Sabrina let out a dejected sigh as she looked down at her sizable bust, a large C lingering close to a small D-cup or it would in time at least. That was one benefit to her new, slovenly lifestyle, the fact her new body fat found its way to her bust and increased its size. Even if she was okay for now, eventually she needed to work. If not as a Gym Leader, she would need to lose weight fast seeing how she had gained some fame in Unova as an actress.

However, Sabrina lacked any proper motivation. Remaining a couch potato for the moment, she flicked on the TV and started to shovel handfuls of popcorn in her mouth from a porcelain blue and white bowl in a bored fashion. She poked at her chubby belly while she continued to eat, opening a can of cola sitting on the table and taking a sip Sabrina looked down at herself, wondering what in the world she could do today in her continued regimen of...doing nothing.

1222.content:
"It's cold outside..."

I look up at down the window, frigid looking raindrops liter the glass. They streak down, reflecting the blue light in the distance. It's calming. But its so cold.

"I don't like the cold..."

I noticed something swaying just behind the glass. It isn't something that's threatening me. In fact, I think it seems almost...

"It's so lonely..."

Sad...

"I hate being alone."

I share a moment of silence with the melancholy figure. It hums a soft pink light that brightens a little bit of the darkness outside. But I can't see its features. If I could, I think it would be frowning. Or crying.

As if it were unaware of my presence the entire time, it suddenly addresses me.

"Are you...Lonely too?"

I want to respond to it. Tell it that its wrong and that it should mind its own business. But...I seem unable or unwillingly to get the words out. This feeling I have...It's haunting.

"Everyone seems happier when they're together...I've never been together with anyone..."

What am I feeling?

"So, why don't we be together?"

~

Sabrina woke up taking a frightened gulp of air. A nameless fear still hung over her and her sheets were covered in a cold sweat.

With her legs in a pyramid, she hugged them slightly. She was trying to place her thoughts as to what she had just experienced. A dream? A vision? That entity that was speaking. Even though she had access to her physic powers most of her life, Sabrina never felt something that vivid before. She looked at her bedroom window. Stale drops of rain water still clung to the glass, but the sky was void of any signs of that pink light.

"Just a dream..." She said to herself.

Sighing in a mixture of confidence and relief, she laid back on the mattress. The stress of training was getting to her. Since the sudden increase in trainers recently, there was a demand to be better and stronger. More so then ever before. Trainers came from all over the world expecting the Saffron City Gym to provide a challenge to them. As the Gym Leader, Sabrina was forced to meet that demand whatever the cost. It was just unfortunate that the cost was usually many sleepless nights spent training both herself and her Pokemon.

She was still wearing her uniform, apparently she had passed out from last night's training. Her Pokemon must have carried her to bed, several of them were snuggled up against each other in the corner of her room. They must have fallen asleep after putting her to bed.

Though she didn't physically smile, Sabrina was somewhat warmed by this sight and quietly stepped out of her room being careful not to disturb them.

"Are you lonely too?"

She froze after halfway closing the door and took one last look out the window. Still, nothing was there. Satisfied, but still somewhat uneasy, she gently shut the door and continued on her way to start the new day...And begin more training.

First things first though, she needed to...
1222.title: Lonely.

12221.content:
A few minutes later Sabrina was in her meditation room. It was a stark room with a polished applewood floor and large walls, each one had a different mural on it, as did the ceiling. One was of a field, lush and vibrating with life, knolls as far as the eye could perceive. The next was of a deep ocean, clear blue and unfathomable...Presenting eternal mystery. The neighboring wall had the image of a mountain high in the heaveans, a light cerulean sky with fluffy nimbus clouds nearby. The fourth wall was of an embryo, life at it's very beginnings and at it's most complex, the fascinating structure that houses the soul before one can formulate thought. Lastly was the ceiling, that showed an artfully painted picture of the universe. One could just make out the Milky Way in a myriad of stars.

It was infinite space, infinite potential.

These images helped Sabrina get into the meditating mood. She closed her eyes and sat down, she emptied her consciousness of every material thing and focused instead on the world around her and her own body. She could feel everything from her own Pokemon nearby and humans miles away. She felt them, their happiness, their worries, and their life. By no means did she invade their thoughts, but instead she gleaned them and analyzed them, which caused her to think of her own issues or successes.

She went about business as usual, when she felt something wrong...She felt a strong wave of lonliness...

Where is it coming from? Sabrina asked herself mentally. She did her best to hone in on it, but whatever it was was quick, elusive, and powerful. If she got close to it, it would put up a mental block. The block was only just strong enough to hold her back no matter how much mental force she used. suddenly she felt...
12221.title: Do her morning meditation.

choices: An assembly call for Gym Leaders.
122212.content:
She felt the presence getting closer. It had suddenly turned the tables, instead of Sabrina pursuing the abnormality it was after her!

Beads of sweat formed at the tip of her brow. She put up a quick mental block, attempting to stave off whatever it was. She felt that the thing's intentions weren't aggressive, but it desperately wanted to be with her for some reason. Putting all her strength into the mental block, Sabrina focused primarily on maintaining it.

Then it was gone.

While she had been busy forming the block, she had completely lost track of it. It had simply vanished as if it never was there. Cautiously lowering the mental block, Sabrina briefly scanned the area for any signs of the lonely emitter. There was nothing.

Then something nudged her in the back.

Yelping slightly, Sabrina's eyes shot wide open and she jumped five feet into the air.

"Mr.Mime?" Asked a goofy voice.

Sabrina landed hard on her bottom. Breathing heavily, she saw immediately what it was that had bumped into her. It was one of her Pokemon, Mr.Mime, who had been cleaning the room. He must have accidentally tapped her with his broom while sweeping around her.

"You...scared me..." She whispered, in her usual monotone voice. Her heart was still going fifty beats a second.

"Mime!" Bowed the Mr.Mime as if he were apologizing.

"It's alright...Just be a little more careful when cleaning, okay?"

"Mime!" He replied as he stumbled out of the room, clattering into a nearby vase directly outside in the hall. There was a crash followed by a smash and more shouts of "Mr.Mime!". Sabrina could only guess what had happened. If she had the capacity to, she'd probably have started to giggle.

But instead she paused to recollect her thoughts, trying to piece together what had happened during meditation. Where ever that strange presence went, it was long gone now. It certainly hadn't come from any of her Pokemon, nor her Mr.Mime who had broken up the tension a great deal. It was foreign and yet so familiar at the same time. Sabrina recalled her dream. They couldn't have been collected, could they?

A tap at the window snapped her back to reality.

There was a Pidgey in the frame with some kind of letter tied to its legs. Standing up, Sabrina opened the window and the bird Pokemon flew, nestling on her shoulders. It stared at her intently, as if it were impatient to deliver the message and be on its way.

"Something for me?" Sabrina asked, carefully slipping the note of the Pidgey's legs.

It was...
122212.title: You tease...

1222121.content:
It was an assembly call for Gym Leaders, apparently. They were ordered to come to the League as soon as possible.

12221212.content:
Sabrina decided to stay and finish her meditation. She wrote a reply and sent the Pidgey off. Then she went to her bed for meditation.

------------------------

Later that night, Sabrina was fast asleep, when she heard a voice say, "Are you lonely?" Sabrina hopped out of bed and said, "Who's there?" "Just me.", the voice replied. Then, a bright pink light shot in front of Sabrina! Pain shot through her body... and then it was over. The light faded off and revealed a Mew. Both bodies were now limp on the floor, and none of Sabrina's pokemon were out. They were alone.

-------------------------

"Ughhhh..." Sabrina said. She got up... but it was... hard. Her arms were shorter then usual, as well as her legs. And something popped out in front of her... a tail? She tried to scream, but all that came out was a small little "mew."

152331.content:
Sabrina's day had begun like any other. She'd woken up, bathed, clothed herself in her pink top with white slacks, socks, and light pink shoes, enjoyed a nice breakfast, accepted and defeated a few trainers. All in all it had been a pretty busy morning and now it was time to rest her weary mind and meditate. She sat down and began to breathe like she had done many times before. In and out, in and out, simple deep breathes. Within moments, Sabrina was calm and her mind clearing as she began to prepare her mental powers and practiced inside her head. However, Sabrina did not get too far into her exercises when suddenly she felt a presence. It seemed unfamiliar to her, but why was it her. However in that moment of pause, she felt the presence reach out to her thoughts. Trying to bring her mental defenses to bear, Sabrina tried to protect herself, but the being was too fast. It quickly reached into her head, touched something like a child playing with a light switch then disappeared.

Waking from her meditation, Sabrina glanced around angrily with her powers coming to bear against her assailant. Yet, as Sabrina scanned her gym, there was no one, not a soul was in the room. Quickly she checked around the gym to see if there was anyone hidden, but there was no one not even the usual grunts that hung around as it was a Saturday and they had the day off. However, as Sabrina tried to focus on where her attacker may be, she sound her mind flowing elsewhere. Eventually her attention turned to her feet of all things and how they were itching inside her shoes.

Sabrina shook her head, she had to focus on finding... what was she looking for again. This really troubled Sabrina. The more she tried to focus on what or where her attacker had gone, the more and more her mind came up blank on whether or not there was even an attacker. Focusing once more she tried again. There was someone in the gym... wasn't there. Well of course there was someone in the gym earlier, there were trainers trying to get there Pokemon League badges. No, no, no, there was something... something... itchy, annoying. Someone was here and they did something.

Throughout all of this, Sabrina had been rubbing her feet together, the material becoming harder and harder to stand. Suddenly it struck her, yes someone was in here earlier and she knew exactly what they had done. Sitting done on the floor, Sabrina looked at the strange pink objects that were covering her feet. They were tight, itchy, annoying, and nearly prevented her from seeing her socks. With two righteous hands, Sabrina grasped the shoe and tore it off her left foot. Tossing the shoe aside as hard as she could, Sabrina turned her attention back to her socked foot and how great it felt to be free of that darn contraption. Grasping her socked foot in both hands, Sabrina practically began to pet her foot feeling how the material dressed her foot elegantly drinking in the smell as if it were wafting from a fragrant flower. However, Sabrina's job was only half done and soon, Sabrina's other shoe was discarded alongside its other, her feet forever free from the tyranny of such cramped devices. Rubbing and petting her socked feet, Sabrina fell into supreme bliss, unaware exactly what had changed her.

What happens next?
152331.title: Yes
